com.sinch.android.rtc.messaging

Class WritableMessage

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.sinch.android.rtc.messaging.WritableMessage

  • public final class WritableMessage
extends Object
    The WritableMessage represents an instant message that is editable and sendable.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      WritableMessage()
      Constructs an empty message with no recipients.
      WritableMessage(List<String> recipientUserIds, String textBody)
      Constructs a message with a list of recipients and a text body.
      WritableMessage(Message message)
      Constructs a message with the recipients, text body and headers from message.
      WritableMessage(String recipientUserId, String textBody)
      Constructs a message with one recipient and a text body.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addHeader(String key, String value)
      Adds a header to the message.
      void addRecipient(String userId)
      Adds a recipient to the message.
      Map<String,String> getHeaders()
      Returns the headers.
      String getMessageId()
      Returns the message identifier.
      List<String> getRecipientIds()
      Returns the list of recipient user identifiers.
      String getTextBody()
      Returns the text body.
      void setTextBody(String textBody)
      The text body of the message.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • WritableMessage

        public WritableMessage(String recipientUserId,
               String textBody)
        Constructs a message with one recipient and a text body. A unique message identifier will be assigned.

      • WritableMessage

        public WritableMessage(List<String> recipientUserIds,
               String textBody)
        Constructs a message with a list of recipients and a text body. A unique message identifier will be assigned.

      • WritableMessage

        public WritableMessage()
        Constructs an empty message with no recipients. A unique message identifier will be assigned.

      • WritableMessage

        public WritableMessage(Message message)
        Constructs a message with the recipients, text body and headers from message. A unique message identifier will be assigned.
        Parameters:
        message - Message to get properties from

    • Method Detail

        public String getMessageId()
        Returns the message identifier.
        Returns:
        the message identified.

      • setTextBody

        public void setTextBody(String textBody)
        The text body of the message. This is the text the recipients of the message will see.
        Parameters:
        textBody - the text body of the message.

      • getTextBody

        public String getTextBody()
        Returns the text body.
        Returns:
        the text body.

      • addRecipient

        public void addRecipient(String userId)
        Adds a recipient to the message.
        Parameters:
        userId - the user id of the recipient.

      • getRecipientIds

        public List<String> getRecipientIds()
        Returns the list of recipient user identifiers.
        Returns:
        the list of recipient user identifiers.

      • addHeader

        public void addHeader(String key,
             String value)
        Adds a header to the message. This header can be retrieved on the remote end by Message.getHeaders()
        Parameters:
        key - the key of the header
        value - the value of the header

      • getHeaders

        public Map<String,String> getHeaders()
        Returns the headers.

        the headers.
